newsitem.title: BELGIUM: D'Ieteren says earnings should rise again.
newsitem.headline: D'Ieteren says earnings should rise again.

text.p: Belgian car importer and distributor D'Ieteren SA said on Thursday it expected earnings to rise again in 1997 in view of its well-stocked orderbook.

The company said in a message to shareholders the prospects for 1997 were "very favourable". In addition, new models announced in the course of 1997, such as the Audi A6, the Skoda Octavia and the VW Passat Variant, would guarantee "an important supply potential."
The company said market share was now 20.7 percent, above 1996's 19.8 percent. For the whole of 1997 car imports should remain more or less steady at the 1996 level.
Net profit rose to 1.622 billion francs in 1996 from 534 million in 1995.
